policy_draft.objectives: To ensure efficient, transparent, and cost-effective procurement processes that meet the organization's needs while complying with all relevant regulations.
policy_draft.scope: This policy applies to all procurement activities within the organization, including the acquisition of goods, services, and works.
policy_draft.procurement_methods: The organization will use competitive bidding, direct procurement, and request for proposals (RFP) as primary methods, depending on the nature and value of the procurement.
policy_draft.evaluation_criteria: Bids will be evaluated based on cost, quality, delivery time, and compliance with technical specifications.
policy_draft.compliance_measures: Regular audits and compliance checks will be conducted to ensure adherence to procurement policies and legal requirements.

procedure_development.step_1: Solicitation of bids: Issue a public notice or invitation to bid, detailing the requirements and submission guidelines.
procedure_development.step_2: Evaluation of received bids: Form a committee to review and score bids based on predefined criteria.
procedure_development.step_3: Negotiation with bidders: Engage in discussions with shortlisted bidders to clarify terms and conditions.
procedure_development.step_4: Awarding of contracts: Select the winning bid and formally award the contract, ensuring all parties are informed.
procedure_development.step_5: Contract management: Monitor contract performance and ensure compliance with agreed terms.
